did.unittitle: Charles I. Walker Collection 1817-18871817-1825
did.abstract: Professor of law at the University of Michigan. Papers collected relating to the founding of the University; include original draft of the act to establish the Catholepistemiad, table explaining meaning of names of professorships, various drafts and amendments, receipts, correspondence, and related documents; contain papers drafted or signed by Augustus B. Woodward, John Monteith, and William Woodbridge.
did.physloc: In vault; access permitted during weekdays only.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was transferred from the Library of the University of Michigan. Donor no. 1278

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research. The collection is available for use only during regular weekday hours.

userestrict.p: Copyright is retained by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

bioghist.p: Professor of law at the University of Michigan.

scopecontent.p: Collected documents relating to the founding of the University, including original draft of the act to establish the Catholepistemiad, table explaining meaning of names of professorships, various drafts and amendments, receipts, correspondence, and related documents; contain papers drafted or signed by Augustus B. Woodward, John Monteith, and William Woodbridge.

did.unittitle: University of Michigan founding documents
Letter to James B. Angell from Charles I. Walker donating these early letters to the University of Michigan, February 11, 1885

The original draft of the act to establish the Catholepistemiad, or University of Michigania, in the handwriting of its author, Judge Augustus B. Woodward; and drafts of other legislation, file dateNovember 7, 1817
A table explaining the meaning of the names of the professorships mentioned in the act

note.p: (in the handwriting of Judge Augustus B. Woodward)

did.unittitle: Memoranda of proposed amendments to Woodward's draft
A draft of an act prepared in, 1818 to provide for the election of Regents of the University (in the handwriting of Judge Woodward and signed by him)
A rough draft of the act of 1821 amending the act to establish the Catholepistemiad, and providing for Regents (in the handwriting of Judge Woodward)
A draft of a new act "to institute a University within the Territory of Michigan", 1825
A draft of a new act "to institute a University within the Territory of Michigan", undated
An enactment by the University of Michigania that subscribers should not be required to pay more than fifty dollars a year; passed, September 12, 1817

note.p: (formally signed by John Monteith, President, and attested by J. L. Whiting, Register)

did.unittitle: Enactment signed and attested, October 3, 1817

note.p: (A fund had been raised for the sufferers of the fire of 1805 in Detroit, Montreal, and elsewhere. The money had not been paid to the sufferers, and this act was to indemnify the holders of the money if they paid it to the University)

did.unittitle: An appointment by John Monteith, President, of George McDougall as Trustee and Visitor of the Classical Academy of Detroit, February 26, 1818
A receipt to Judge A. B. Woodward for his subscription to the University for the year, 1817
Three letters from the Judge B. F. H. Witherell to Judge Woodward, calling upon him to pay his subscription to the University
A brief history of the University of Michigan, by C. I. Walker, published in the newspapers, 1869
A letter from Governor William Woodbridge to Judge Woodward making reference to those who should be chosen President and the Professors at the opening of the Catholepistemiad, undated
Other documents (letter and enclosures)
Letter from Judge James V. Campbell (with enclosures), March 15, 1887
Report of the Committee on the organization, and government of the University, March 17, 1838
Report of the Monroe Branch, University of Michigan, March 9, 1838
